Owners Dolly and Anne are often there during the week and always at weekends. Dance floor and seperate area for pool. Going strong since it first opened. 'Very, very highly recommended.

title: The Smart Bar
description: Tel. 549-0203. This one sounds like a welcome new addition to the Chicago bar scene. Features new wave and disco dancing. Hi-camp movies. Refreshments on Wednesdays. Gay owned by a real nice guy. Open 9pm-2am Thursdays thru Saturday. Clientele: mostly gay women most of the time. Very highly recommended. Be sure to say 'Hi' from GAIA.

title: Augi & CK's
description: (New Town) Tel. 975-0449. Open 7pm-4am. Sat: till 5am. Closed Mondays. Big dance floor, weekend DJ. Very popular, but also 'the crowd in this place can be quite rough!' 'Three pieces of picture ID required for women of colour who are not personally known to the management.' Pool table, pacman, live entertainment. No food. Friday and Saturday night $2.00 cover charge.

title: Lady Bug
description: (New Town) Tel. 281 3336. Mon-Fri 6pm-4am, Sat 3pm-5am, Sun 3pm-4am. Clientele: more business and professional women. Atmosphere: more conducive to conversation than most other bars. Dancing. No food.

title: Gallagher's
description: Tel. 891-9076. Dance bar. Disco. It's really nice, caters mainly for gays. However a few straight couples do attend. Very relaxed atmosphere. Two women bartenders and recommended.

title: Closet
description: Tel. 477-8533. This place is at its best either during cocktail hour or after hours. It's very small with a small dance floor. The Juke Box is good, the staff is friendly. Cl1entele: gay women and men.

title: Jimmy's Hideaway
description: (was D'ROSE'S HIDEAWAY) 905 W Belmont Ave Tel. 549-8756. Lounge bar. No dancing. Clientele: all gay and 50% women. Hours: Monday to Friday 1 1am-2am. Saturday 9am-3am. Sunday 12 noon-2am.

title: Norma's
description: Tel. 871-4880. Formerly HAPPY MEDIUM then AUGIE'S. Open 7 days: 7pm-2am, Sat to 3am. 'A friendly quiet place, a good place to go if you just want a quiet drink. Cl1entele: often more gay men than women.

title: Annex 2
description: Tel. 644-5268. Disco and sit-down type lounge bar. Quiet atmosphere. The Sunday Tea Dance attracts many women, also Sunday buffet. Open 4pm-4am 7 days a week.

title: Factory
description: (North West) Tel. 549-4166. Lounge in the front, disco room in the rear/plus separate dining room Hours 8pm-4am during the week. 8pm-5am on Saturday. Clientele: 70% gay men, 30% gay women. Recommended.

title: The Lite Factory
description: (New Town) Tel. 281-9661. Drag shows and disco. Open 4pm-4am.

title: La Cage Chicago
description: Tel 944-3293. Drag shows, dancing. Two shows every day but Wednesday, 10.30 pm and 12.30am. Thursday $5.00 entrance/open bar. Wednesday no cover charge. Restaurant dance bar. Cl1entele: 60% gay men, 40% gay women. Recommended.

title: Baton Show Lounge
description: (Near North Side) Tel. 644-5269. Open 8pm-4am. Closed Mon and Tues. Wednesday thru Sunday 8.00pm excellent drag shows. Women welcome.

title: His'N'Hers
description: (New Town) Tel. 935-1210. Live entertainment and good food. Open 12 noon-2am 7 days a week. Cover charge Friday and Saturday nights $3.00. Clientele· gay women and men.

title: Mountain Moving Coffeehouse
description: (in the church basement) non-alcoholic wimmen only space. Woman talent featured. Open Sat 7.30pm-1 lpm. Suggested donation: $3.50.

title: Somewhere
description: Tel. 472-8708. An Alternative gathering place. Coffeehouse/Entertainment/RAP Groups/Table Games/Refreshments/Special Events/ Friday nights only from 8:00pm-11:00pm.

title: The Courtyard Inn
description: 60610 Tel. 664-7378. Warm, cozy atmosphere .. featuring BBQ baby back ribs and a full range of prime steaks, fish, chicken and sandwiches. Reasonable prices and all major credit cards are accepted. Open for lunch, dinner and Sunday brunch.

title: The Other Brother
description: Tel. 935-7793. Clientele: Gay women and men.

title: My Brother's Place
description: Tel. 321-0776. Clientele: gay men and women.

title: The Brewery
description: Tel. 929-9773. 'Excellent food in a great environment - close to the bars.· Very highly recommended.

title: Random House
description: Tel. 871-2600. Open 24 hours. After hours meeting place. Homemade soups and breakfast things like pecan waffles and Hawaiian pancakes.

title: Riversedge
description: Tel. 467-1772. Gay owned. Across from Merchandise Mart.

title: Bake Shop Cafe
description: 60625 (at Lincoln Square) Tel. 334-1347. Fresh and natural light meals and desserts. Open Mon-Fri. 11am-7pm. Sat 11am-5pm.

title: Women & Children First
description: (just off Halsted) Tel. 871-7417. Tues-Sat· 1lam-7pm. Sun: Noon-6pm. Books, women's records, music, posters, buttons, jewelry, T-shirts, MAIL ORDER and large stock of children's books. Meeting space/bulletin board/ coffee and tea. Tuesday night programs. Recordings, discussion groups, workshops. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Jane Addams Bookstore
description: 60605 (2nd floor 1nFine Arts Building) Tel. 663-1885. Women's titles, lesbian titles, rare women's books, free search service for out-of-print books, posters, women's records plus non-sexist children's books and GAIA'S GUIDE. Open Mon-Sat 10am-5pm but Thurs until 6pm. Sun 12 noon-5pm. Also coffee shop serving coffee/herb tea/cider/wholewheat pastries/yogurt served at the store Readings and events. Beautiful new space overlooking Grant Park.

title: New World Resource Center
description: Tel. 348-3370. Alternative bookstore with a wide selection of left-wing and anti-imperialist literature and women's books and records, posters, buttons, bulletin board/coffee and tea/special happenings. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE. Open Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday 2pm-8pm.

title: Bobs
description: In New Town: 2810 North Clark; 60657 Tel. 883-1123. Hours: Sam-12 midnight 7 days a week. Extremely well stocked general new stand with a huge selection of gay titles. lesbian titles. women's titles. Magazines too. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE

title: Fox Valley Gay Women's Association
description: 60120. Tel 931 1110 (Monday-Thursday 7pm-10pm). Lesbians in Elgin meet and enjoy each other's company.

title: Kinheart Inc
description: at North Shore Women's Center 2214 Ridge Ave 6020 Tel. 491 1103. Office hours: Tues-Fri 1-5pm. Ask for Mary Jo or Phyllis. Fri night 8-11pm is drop in night for lesbians. Thurs night is drop in night for all women. Program on homosexuality and homophobia. Consultations educational exams special evenings for lesbians only. Counseling support groups.OpenedOctober1982

title: Platypus Bookstore
description: (corner of Dempster and Chicago) Tel. 866 8040. Alternative bookstore selling women's music and lots of feminist and lesbian literature. Open 10.30am-6pm They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Volume III Bookstore
description: 60201 Altemative bookstore-well stocked with gay/lesbian and feminist titles.

title: Quench Room
description: Tel. 6769536. Under new management Very pleasant atmosphere, remodeled and now very clean. Open 3pm-1am 7 days a week, Clientele: all gay and at least 50% women. Weekends especially good, Recommended.

title: Freddy's Bistro
description: Tel. 6729430. Relaxed community bar, pool table, dance room, food service. Women's pool tournaments. Light shows to synchronize Juke box. Hot dogs served. Recommended.

title: Mr C's
description: 60104 Tel. 962 2380. Huge dance floor and U shaped bar. Clientele: 50% gay women. Open 4pm to 2am and Thurs, opens noon.

title: Jr's Country Disco
description: Tel. 78 9411. Pool table. DJ dance floor/lounge area.

title: Augie's
description: 61201 Tel. 788-7389. Pool table/juke box. Clientele: 50% gay and OK for gay women. Open 5pm-3am.

title: Smokey's Den
description: Tel. 522 0301. Dance bar/opens 12 noon 1am, 6 days a week. Thurs, opens at 6pm. Clientele: gay women and men. Woman owned.

title: Horizon Bookstore
description: 61801 Tel. 328 2988. General bookstore Gay/lesbian and feminist titles. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: The Swinging Door
description: Tel.7.Ladiesnight isFriday. The rest of the time it's 50-50 and all gay. Occasional drag shows and special happenings.

title: Bullwinkle's
description: Tel. 334-3232. Disco and restaurant on 2 floors but it's likely that the entertainment bar(upstairs) will attract mostly straights. The rest of the complex is all gay, and mostly women. Open 5pm-3am six days a week. Closed on Sundays.

title: Depot Lounge
description: Tel. 933 9496. Two bars. Disco and lounge. Disco weekends only. Clientele: all gay and 30% gay women. Recommended.

title: Labyris
description: 46202 Tel. 635-3638. Lesbian owned and operated super bar. Dancing, vegetarian food, games, community benefits. They now publish their own events calendar to publicise their own happenings which include open mike nights, pool tournaments, concerts, 'working women's lunches'. All sorts of community benefits. Snacks are served and they are open: Monday-Friday 10.3Qam-2.30pm and 4pm-3am. Saturdays: 7pm-3am and Sundays closed. LABYRISis just about as highly recommended as a women's bar can get.

title: Womanspace + Dreams & Swords
description: write PO Box 16305: 46216 Location: 3711 North Sherman Drive. Tel 926-6110 (Womanspace). 546-2623 (Dreams & Swords/Feminist Bookstore)

title: PSIS
description: (Comer South Anthony and Simon) Tel. 424-9912. Open 4:00pm-3:00am weekends and Tuesday thru' Thursday open till 2:00 am.

title: Won-Ten
description: Tel. 635-0961. Bar and restaurant, live bands. Disco and shows. Snacks and games. 'Slightly older crowd', A very, very highly recommended fun bar. Clientele: 95% gay women. Hours: 10am-3am Monday thru Saturday.

title: Gay & Lesbian Organization (GLO)
description: 46863. Tel. Helpline 744-0484. They hold Lesbian Dances at the YWCA. Their publication: TROIS. The GLO has a Lesbian Rap Group, an outreach drop-in center Sun-Thurs 2pm-1am. Fri-Sat 2pm-3am. Also the Jewish Group (Light From The Valley) meets through GLO

title: Rainbows of Life
description: 46802 Tel. 422-7913. Books, records, tapes: feminist, metaphysical, holistic, gay and lesbian owned. Psychic fairs, bulletin board. EXTREMELY community minded, women-run bookstore. A first stop when new in Fort Wayne and be sure to say 'hi' from GAIA. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE. Hours: Mon-Fri; 10am-7:30pm. Sat 10am-5pm, Sun: 12 noon-5pm.

title: The Chase
description: tel. 637-8797. Disco plus three floors of super-bars. Open 8pm-12:30am. Pizzas and sandwiches are served. Clientele: 70% gay men, 30% gay women.

title: Talbott Street
description: 46202. Tel. 925-2411. Candlelight cabaret and disco. Drag shows on Monday and Thursday nights. Live acts once a month. TALBOTT STREET opens at 8pm and there is a $1.00 cover during the week. $2.00 cover at weekends/drink specials. Clientele: 75% gay women/25% gay men and very highly recommended.

title: Mark III
description: Tel. 282-8273. Dance bar. Sandwiches are served. Clientele specials and cocktail hour. Clientele: 30% gay women, some gay men and some others. Opens 9am-3am Monday to Saturday. Sunday 12:30 noon-12 midnight.

title: The Ruins
description: Tel. 262-9401. Excellent food and good music. Open 5pm-3am. Recommended. Drag show 3 nights a week, also dancing. Never a cover charge. 'We welcome gay women.'

title: Varsity (CIEL'S)
description: 46202. Tel. 635-9998. Dinner specials and cocktail hour. Clientele: 30% gay women, some gay men and some others. Opens 9am-3am Monday to Saturday. Sunday 12:30 noon-12 midnight.

title: Seahorse II Cabaret
description: Tel. 237-9139. A gay bar for men and women. Occasional shows.

title: Carriage House
description: Tel. 282-7411. Open 7 days a week from 4pm-1am. Sunday closes at 12:30am. NOTE:THIS BAR IS NOT OPENLY GAY.

title: Seahorse II
description: Tel. 237-9139. Reopened after fire. 95% gay. Sometimes more gay women, sometimes less. Disco and shows.

title: Rosalea's house
description: 67058. 'Rosales is an artist and a feminist - a one-woman army in Harper. ' the house is a wonderful experience and every room is unique. Open May 31st thru Labor Day. No phone. 'The oasis of the Bible Belt... since 1968.' Reservations are a MUST.

title: The Women's Coalition
description: University of Kansas Tel. 854 4934. Switchboard and other services and facilities too numerous to mention. very highly recommended as being nice people. Go visit them when you-re in Lawrence.

title: Pete's Pub
description: Tel. 722 9667. Clientele: 98% women and one of the few open on Sundays.

title: Gay Information
description: Tel. 235-0235. An extremely informative taped message gives you the current details regarding the bar scene, MCC/counseling service/AA/other groups and current activities.

title: LAMBDA Club
description: Tel. 296 9089. Private club. open 7 days a week until 3:00am. Disco pin ball. A gay owned. gay operated community minded bar. highly recommended.

title: Spinsters Books
description: Tel. 843 9574. Lesbian and feminist titles. your first stop in Lawrence. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Jerry's Place
description: Tel. 358-3524. Dancing. Food served. No cover charge. Atmosphere homely, nice and quiet. Clientele: almost all gay women. Open 12 noon-2:30am and recommended very, very highly. Be sure to say 'hi' from GAIA.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: Meets at Unitarian Church 4th and York Tel. 366-4052. Sunday meetings: new outreach to lesbian community.

title: The Lavender Letter
description: 420207 Tel. 969-1908. Free in bars, etc. or $5.00 pa, 12 issues.

title: The Bungalow
description: (near Main) Lexington, Kentucky; 40507. Tel. 255-7477. Open 11am-1am. Recommended. Feminist clientele. Everyone welcome. Lunch: Tues-Fri 11:30am-2:00pm. Dinner: Tues-Thurs 6:30-9:30pm. Fri-Sat 6:30-10:00pm. Brunch: Sat. 10:00am-2:00pm. Small but comfortable cozy atmosphere and decor. Recommended.

title: Kentucky Collection of Lesbian Herstory (KCLH)
description: Write PO Box 1701; 40201 Tel. 634-1869. Lesbian/Separatist starting point in Louisville. Contact them for information regarding the women's bar: FOURTH STREET PUB ($report back with full details, please).

title: Equality Products
description: 40205. Badges, bumper stickers, T-shirts, stationary, jewelry, etc.

title: The New Downtowners/Ladies Choice
description: Tel. 583-1166. LADIES CHOICE is the basement in the NEW DOWNTOWNER. Dance floor, pool table, pin ball. It's open every day of the week from 9pm-4am. Drag shows upstairs. Recommended.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: Po Box 8223, 40208 Tel. 583-4052. They meet at the First Unitarian Church comer 7th and York. Worship services every Sunday at 7pm. The Reverends are both lesbians.

title: Silly Sally's
description: 71360 Tel. 448-9164. A very, very highly recommended disco and show bar. Women's entertainment, rights/pool and other games. Open Mon-Sat: 2pm-2am. Say that GAIA sent you.

title: Impact
description: 70152 Tel. (504) 948-9244. Excellent coverage of events and happiness in Louisiana. includes directory of all groups, centers, contacts, resources, etc.

title: Snootee Fox Lounge
description: Tel. 746-9664. very friendly, very nice women's bar. Dancing and games. 'We have a women's band entertaining every other Sat night.' Open 8pm-2am. A private club but you can get in with a copy of GAIA"S GUIDE and valid ID. Just say that 'GAIA' sent you.

title: The Dock
description: Tel. 346-0938. Most complete disco light show anywhere. Pool tables, pin ball and entertainment. Private club, open Mon-Sat; 5pm-2am. Cover charges on certain nights. Plan to arrive before 10pm Recommended.

title: George's Place
description: Tel. 387-8537. 'Had a face lift-Nov 1980'. Happy hour: Mon-Sat 3:30pm-6:30pm; open 3pm till 2:30am Mon-Sat. Patio, game room, island type bar. Quite ok for gay women.

title: The Cock and Bull
description: Tel. 387-9549. bar/restaurant with a separate women's room which has juke box and pool tables- 'Western Recipes'. Open daily: 4pm-2am and 5pm-midnight on Sundays. Recommended.

title: Care and Counseling Center
description: Tel. 947-4297. Counseling/group therapy/gay parents meetings/socials for couples/speakers bureau/hospital and jail visits/friendship rituals. 'A mini social services agency operated by GAYS FOR GAYS'.

title: Grace Fellowship in Christ Jesus
description: Mailing address PO Box 30183; 70190 Office/personage: Tel. 944-9836. They meet at the St Louis Community Center. A non-denominational Christian family meeting Sundays.

title: Metropolitan Community Church of New Orleans
description: Meets at First Unitarian Church, 1800 Jefferson Avenue, Tel. 899-1468. Sunday services/Weds evening dinner meetings.

title: LAMBDA CHAI
description: 70116 or call 524-6932 (Shalom). New Orleans only Gay-Jewish congregation. Religious services every Friday, 8pm.

title: Pino's
description: Tel. 944-WHAT. Dance floor/pool tables/afternoon socials 5-7. Open 5pm till... weekdays and 2pm till... weekends. Very new and already getting many, many, letters of excellent recommendation.

title: Bourbon Pub, Inc & Parade Disco
description: 70116 Tel. 523-9720. Top Twenty in sounds, light show, hand painted walls and furniture. PARADE DISCO is mixed gay and women very, very, welcome. Pool table, pin ball, private club. PARADE DISCO is open 9pm-late. BOURBON PUB open 24 hours but it's 95% men Open 7days a week.

title: Soiled Dove Saloon Bar
description: Tel. 525-1459. Women's Western Bar. Sunday evening it's Kim Williams and her Lesbian Country/Western Band. Opens every day of the year at 2pm until closing.

title: Diane's
description: 70116 Tel. 523-9527 or 833-9213. Dancing floor, pool tables, and other games. Every Saturday night-oldies but goldies. 'A gay unity bar' -women entertainers, community benefits, snacks served, Open Mon-Thurs 4pm till... Fri, Sat, and Sun 12 noon till... 'The same friendly and warm atmosphere will continue at DIANE'S.' Very highly recommended.

title: The Clinic
description: Tel. 522-1585. A nice, friendly bar-open 24 hours a day 7 days a week (but don't walk around alone in the neighborhood). However, 'This is a nighbohood bar with pool table, pac man, sometimes 100% gay women'.

title: Mississippi River Bottom
description: Tel. 566-0665. 'Some women do frequent' . Open 10am till close.

title: Charlene's
description: Tel. 945-9328. Dance bar and show bar featuring the very best in women entertainers, community benefits, pool table. A private club, but a copy of GAIA"S GUIDE plus valid ID will get you in. Open Tues-Thurs, 4pm till... Fri-Sun 2pm till... juke box, video games and very, very friendly women. Say 'hi' from GAIA.

title: Lucille's and Friend
description: Tel. 524-8840. Open 24 hours a day 7 days a week. Pool table, pinball, video games. Gay women are always welcome here.

title: Flamingo's
description: Tel. 523-6141. Gay run by very, very nice people. Clientele: gay women and men and a few others. Very highly recommended. Be sure and say 'hi' from GAIA.

title: Enraged Chicken
description: (off 100 Block of Magazine) Tel. 524-8636. Open for lunch and dinner. Closed Sundays. Enormous menus. Clientele: gay women and gay men (about equal). Reservations required.

title: Bob's
description: Tel. 945-1703. Clientele: gay women and men (about equal) and recommended.

title: Lafitte
description: 70016 (near Philips) Tel. 581-2678. Writes a woman contributor; 'I highly recommend this place; although predominantly gay male, women are made very, very welcome. The rooms are furnished in antiques and mine had a gas-burning coal fireplace. 'Conveniently located in the French Quarter. Rates: $53.00-$77.00 a day single including continental breakfast.

title: Faubourg Marigny Bookstore
description: 70116 (Comer of Chartre and Frenchmen St) Tel. 943-9875. Gay Bookstore with women's titles, posters, records, buttons. MAIL ORDER SERVICE. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE and are open 11am-6pm seven days a week. 'An emporium for ideas'.

title: The Country Club
description: Tel. 945-9395. It really is a country club; swimming pool, bar and game room. TV and reading room. It's located in an old creole cottage and the membership is private. Cocktail bar and rooms available for private parties. Very, very highly recommended. Open 7 days per week: 10am-10pm.

title: Bourgoyne
description: 70116 Tel. 524-3621 or 525-3983. 'In the heart of the attractions of New Orleans' "French Quarter". 'Gay clientele and very reasonable rates. Highly recommended. Extremely hospitable, supportive people. Say 'hi' from GAIA.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: Shreveport/Bossier City: write Shreveport Human Rights PO Box 4231, Shreveport; 71104 tel. 221-8172. A Christian church with a special outreach to lesbians and gay men.

title: My Way
description: (was the OTHER SIDE): 1605 Marshall Tel. 221-9543. Clientele: gay and straight. Drag shows Thursday nights.

title: Bobbies Korner
description: Woman owned and very comfortable. Highly recommended.

title: Everywoman's Center
description: 01002 Tel. 545-0883 (taped message). They publish a newsletter and magazine: CHOMO-URI.

title: The Women's List
description: 02116. The what and where of women's action groups in the greater Boston area. $3.95 plus 60c postage.

title: Young Gay and Proud
description: Room 309 02111 Tel. 542-5679. 'Every teenager's guide to Gayness' from Alyson Publications. $3.50 post paid.

title: Focus (From the D O B)
description: (Cambridge) 02138 Tel. 661-3633/259 0063. A journal for gay women. Published by the DAUGHTERS OF BILITIS (D O B/Boston Chapter). Fiction, poetry, and reviews plus D O B calendar of events. $.75 per copy. $8.00 per year. Overseas: $9.00.

title: Lesbian and Gay Hotline
description: 02106 Tel. 426-9371. 'Serving the entire North Eastern States Region and able to provide national gay community information.'

title: Daughters of BILITIS (D O B)
description: 02138 (Cambridge) Tel. 661-3633. 'We hold weekly discussion meetings open to all women and centering around living the lesbian experience' Their publication: FOCUS.

title: Equal Times
description: 02116. 1 year for $8.00. Boston's newspaper for working women.

title: Gay Community News (GCN)
description: Subscription 167 Tremont St (5th floor); 02111. Weekly, non-sexist gay newspaper. Excellent resource material. $6.00 for a 12 week subscription.

title: Fenway Community Health Center
description: Tel. 267-7573. Lesbian medical providers. By appointment Mon-Fri. Days and Monday evening.

title: Musically Speaking
description: WMBR 88 1FM 1-4pm. Women's programming-music, ideas, and announcements. Call Melanie at 494-8810 with events and comments.

title: Commonground
description: WMBR Radio Cambridge 88.1 FM. Friday evenings Tel. 253-4000. 2 Ames St Cambridge 02142. Founded by a woman, this is radio for lesbians and gay men.

title: Boston's Other Voice.
description: WROR 98 5FM 10:30pm. Weekly discussions of problems facing the lesbian/gay community. News, views, calendar, music.

title: Gay Way Radio
description: WBUR (90.0 FM). Tel 353-2790. Every Tuesday at 8:30 pm.

title: Janus Counseling for Lesbians
description: (Janus House) Cambridge Tel. 661-2537. Individual, group, and couple therapy for lesbian women. Serving the community since 1974.

title: Behavior Associates of Boston
description: 02116. Tel. 262-9116. Serving the community. Weight control/Anxiety reduction/Depression/Assertiveness training/gay and lesbian couples counseling/Social skills training/Phobias/Hypnosis. 'Call for a consultation with one of our licensed psychologists, social workers or career counselors.'

title: Expressions
description: Tel. 666-5697. Therapy for women/individuals, couples, groups/lesbian relationship issues/sexuality/incest/abuse/removing barriers to intimacy. Sliding scale.

title: Women's Health Spa
description: Tel. 423-7730. Featuring a racquetball court, universal gym, jacuzzi and sauna.

title: NOW/Boston Chapter:
description: 02139 Tel. i661-6015. NOW NEWS is published monthly at our office. Deadline for advertising: 1st of the month. Subscription: $3.00 for non-members.

title: Gay Professional Women's Association
description: Boston U Station 02215. A large organization of lesbians in the professions. They meet regularly (meetings half lecture/presentation, half social) and have brenches on Worchester and Lexington.

title: Exodus Center
description: 02116. Tel. 266-0612. Day-long workshops, weekend retreats, primarily organized by gay religious groups.

title: Isaiah's Lounge
description: 01605 Tel. 798 8950/791 71 95. A disco bar. Good place to talk and meet old and new friends. Monthly entertainment. open every day from 4pm-2am except Sun, 4pm-1am. Games and snack and quite ok for gay men. Recommended.

title: The Gay Dating Show
description: Marblehead 01945. A new concept for the gay community- a new way for gay women (and men) to meet each other. You just call in and describe yourself and the type of person you would like to meet. If a listener thinks you sound appealing, they call in and you're away. Other types of advertising too.

title: Glad Day Bookstore
description: Tel. 452 0144. One of the most well-stocked gay bookstores in the world. Lesbian and feminist titles and periodicals. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: The Marquee
description: (Central Square) Cambridge 02138 Tel. 492 9545. Disco, pool tables, pinball. A marvellous place for gay women, epsecially those who like to view the vamps on the wall (Mae West, Marilyn Monroe etc.) Great for dancing, open 7days a weel. They Sponsor local athletes and sports teams in the Cambridge Women's League. Very highly recommended. Open 7 days a week. Weds 2 for 1.

title: Pipeline
description: Kenmore Square 9 Lansdowne St. Recommended disco. Games room.

title: Somewhere
description: Tel. 423-7730. Seven days a week, a place for all women. Open noon-2am. Sundays: brunch 1-4pm. Live entertainment and tea dances 5-7pm. large TV screen, hot dog, dance till the morning hours. Lots of rave recommendations always come in for this one.

title: Together
description: (next to Colonial Theater) Tel. 426 0086. Highly recommended supper bar.

title: Paradise
description: Tel. 864-4130. A nice place with a quiet atmosphere- but mostly gay men.

title: Common Stock
description: Tel. 247-8249. 'A restaurant for gay women, men and their friends.' Breakfast, lunch, dinner, late nights, fabulous weekend brunches. Many, many letters recommend this as an excellent and low-priced, high quality women's restaurant.

title: The Ideal
description: (Copley Square) Tel. 247-8249. 'A restaurant for gay women, men and their friends.' Breakfast, lunch, dinner, late nights, fabulous weekend brunches. Many, many letters recommend this as an excellent and low-priced, high quality women's restaurant.

title: Modern Times
description: Tel. 354-8371. Dinners, desserts expresso, films and live music. plus, women's film nights, women's music nights.

title: Oasis
description: (chapel entrance) tel. 536-7050. Coffeehouse with music, run by MAXINE FELDMAN. Weds-Sun 7:30pm.

title: Words Worth
description: 02138 Tel. 547-5201. Alternative bookstore with gay titles, women's titles. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Avenue Victor Hugo Bookshop
description: Tel. 266-7746. Women's poetry and poetry readings by women. Coffeehouse type poetry reading nights.

title: Grolier Book Shop
description: 02133 Tel 547 4648. General bookstore- gay/lesbian/women's title. 'POETRY only with a very solid collection of gay authors; we carry gay literacy periodicals, some of the poets reading are gay poets, but our emphasis is poetry. Mail and special orders invited.

title: Glad Day Bookstore
description: temporary location at CARRIER PIGEON 74 Kneeland St tel. 542-5679. Trying and reopen as soon as possible after being burnt out by fire on July 7 1982.

title: Women's Emporium
description: Tel. 661 2059. Crafts, funky furniture and clothes. Tues-Sat 11am-6pm.

title: Cauldron Experimental Theater
description: 02118. Tel. 542 8575. 'We are a Lesbian Community Theater featuring long run theater productions, poetry, visual art, film, dance rituals political forums and more. We have a big empty loft space in Bsoton's South End founded in January 1981... lesbian theater is a viable artform.'

title: The New England Women's Gym
description: Studio 107 46 Waltham St 02118 Tel. 451 3514. Lesbian run/owned gym. A supportive environment, designed for women interested in WEIGHT TRAINING, BODY BUILDING and POWER LIFTING. All women are welcome (beginners to professionals).

title: Green River Cafe
description: Tel. 773-9077. Gay coffeehouse. Women's entertainment. Community benefits, special women's nights. 'We are a consciousness-raising restaurant- a collective trying yo bring creative new ideas to the general public... new ownership, new philosophy'. Very highly recommended.

title: The Bookswap
description: Tel. 774-3989. Used books/feminist titles and Olivia Records.

title: World Eye Bookshop
description: 01301 Tel. 772-0844. General bookstore with women's titles, gay titles, lesbian titles. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Lesbian Support Group
description: 02601. Tel. 771-6739. At MERCY OTIS WOMEN'S CENTER. Additional address: 298 Main Street.

title: Blue Anchor
description: get address and phone number and report back!

title: Fran's Place
description: Tel. 595 8961. Dance floor with disco lights. Pool table, video games, 8/9 booths, juke box, DJ booth. Quite a large bar seating 200 people.

title: The Iron Horse Coffeehouse
description: Tel. 584 0610 (recording) 584 3177. Live music 7 nights a week- the best in women's entertainment. Monthly events schedule. Coffee Happy hour: 8am- 10am. Serves 3 meals a day. Brunch served Sat and Sun until 2:30pm.

title: The Polish Club
description: ask a WOMONFYRE BOOKS. 'Lesbians get together for socializing at the POLISH CLUB.'

title: Womonfyre Books
description: 01060 Tel 586-6445. Women's books, records, posters, T-shirts, jewelry, magazines, buttons. Ticket outlet for wimmin's concerts, bumper stickers, cards and GAIA'S GUIDE. Open 10am-6pm Tues/Weds/Thurs & Fri 12 noon-5pm Saturady. 'We love visitors.' MAIL ORDER SERVICE/information Notebook/'Meet the Author'.

title: Beyond Words
description: Tel. 586 6304. 'We carry books that celebrate the feminist spirit.' Including GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Broadside Bookshop
description: Tel. 586 4235. Feminist and gay titles. Hours: Mon thru Sat 9:30-5:30pm. Thursday evening 7-9pm on the spring, summer and fall.

title: The Sleepy Pilgrim Motel
description: Tel. 746-1962. 'A motel for all people'- air conditioning, color tv, walk to the beach or relax in the tree-shaded grounds.' Pets welcome. Recommended.

title: Pennacook Guest House
description: 02557 Tel. 693 1231. Near beach and shopping area. Gay male owned, receptive and friendly to gay women. 'We welcome you.'

title: Everywoman's Center
description: Box 949 for mail; location 14 Center St 02657. Supposed to be open from 4-6pm. Check it out and report back.

title: Cafe Edwige
description: Breakfast, lunch, dinner, full bar. 'Excellent food and very pleasant atmosphere.'

title: Vorelli's
description: Mail PO Box 901; 02657. No phone. Very popular restaurant with show bar/lounge area. They feature women entertainers as well as men. The atmosphere is always extremely pleasant and the central location is excellent. Clientele: gay women and men and a few others. Summer season only. Very highly recommended.

title: Pied Piper
description: Mail to PO Box 680; 02657. Location: 193 commercial Street 02657 (Alley) Tel. 487-1527. Top disco, top entertainment, excellent restaurant, game room, piano bar, pinball and pool tables. Exciting atmosphere overlooking the water and all of Provincetown-decks for summer sunning and swimming. Open 10am-1am. THE place for women in Provincetown. By far one of the most highly recommended women's bars in the world. Exceptionally friendly.

title: The Cellar/at the CROWN AND ANCHOR
description: Tel. 487-1430. An all women's bar and a quiet respite from the disco scene. 'A place for women and their friends to meet.' Entertainment weekends (seasonal).

title: The Town House
description: Tel. 487 0292. Super bar complex. 50% straight, 50% gay.

title: Womencrafts
description: Mail Po Box 190; 02657. Location: 373 Commercial Street Tel. 487-9854. Feminist books, records, gifts, handcrafts, jewelry and many other items especially for lesbians- including records, gifts, handcrafts, jewelry and many other items especially for lesbians-including GAIA'S GUIDE. They have a bulletin board for accommodation, events, etc. Open during the summer only. Say hi from GAIA.

title: The Gull Walk-Inn
description: Mail to PO Box 456; 02657. Location: 300A Commercial St Tel. 487-9027. AN ALL WOMEN'S GUEST HOUSE (for 6 years!) Reasonable rates. Central location, large front yard and porch, TV/social lounge. Three steps off Commercial St, right near the bus depot, Boston ferry and the beach. OPEN ALL YEAR ROUND. Highly recommended.

title: Sea Fox (was Back Stage)
description: PO Box 193 186 Commercial St 02657 Tel. 487 3536. Mellow and comfortable. Show tunes and tapes of older music (40s to 60s). Omelettes plus fairly extensive breakfast and lunch menu. Gay owned. Gets the late night crowd. Open: 7am-2:30pm and 11pm-3am. Very highly recommended.

title: Lobster Pot
description: One block from the wharf and seems like the same menu as the old CLAMBAKE. It is fabulous! Clientele:mixed. Bar staff: gay and lesbian.

title: Angel's Landing
description: 02657 Tel. 487 1420. Studies and apartments on the waterfront in the heart of Provincetown. Private beach, sundecks and a gorgeous view of the bay. Woman owned and operated. Gay women are more than welcome here. Say that GAIA sent you.

title: Pilgrim House Hotel
description: 02657 Tel. 487-0319. A hotel for gay women and men- 50 rooms. Also disco and lounge with top name live entertainment. Dinners served. Piano bar and open mike nights. Very highly recommended.

title: The Gabriel Apartments
description: 02657 Tel. 487-3232. Furnished apartments and rooms for women only. Hot tub/sun deck/meeting/gathering space. Free coffee in central location. Free brochure upon request. 'Courtyard bar-B-ques/women's art gallery'. Women own and operate this resort guest house.

title: Renaissance Apartments
description: 02657. Tel. 487-3083 (May-Oct) and (Chicago) (312) 752-1166 Oct-May. Situated in Provincetown's historic West End. These are fully and newly decorated apartments across the street from the beach. Free parking and pets welcome. Owned by two friendly young guys who've been together for over 20 years. Welcome gay women. Theirs is a small operation. 'Many women recommend RENAISSANCE.'

title: Watership Inn
description: 02657 Tel. 487-0094. 'Serving gay women and gay men.' The location is good and central, the rooms are unique and comfortable. Private baths, contintetal breakfasts. The atmosphere is friendly and homey. Bar mixes are also available and WATERSHIP INN is very, very highly recommended.

title: The Captain and His Ship
description: 02657 Tel. 487 1850. An old Victorian house which has been restored and kept very nicely. Reasonable rates, living room with color TV, open all year round. Walking distance to shops, bars and beach. Rooms with water view. Very highly recommended by traveling gat women.

title: Richmond Inn
description: Tel. 487-9193. 20 feet from Commercial Street and 3 blocks from PIED PIPER. It's a nice place to stay, gay owned and about $30.00 a night for a double.

title: Boatslip Hotel
description: Tel. 487 1669. Bar and swimming pool plus disco. Gay Clientele and very, very highly recommended. 6 apartments/40 rooms. Restaurant. Motel.

title: Twelve Center
description: Tel. 487-0381. An elegant 1872 house. Rates $28 double. Efficiency cottage $40 per night, $250 per week. Complimentary coffee. 'Wonderful guest house-great hosts, Roger and Jon, made us feel welcome. Very good prices and clean lovely rooms. They give comp tickets to some of the bars too.'

title: Haven House
description: Tel. 487 3031. Swimming pool. Open year round.

title: Sandpiper Beach House
description: 02657 Tel. 487 1928. Nice rooms, friendly, helpful, happy people.' Located on beach and next door to the BOATSLIP MOTOR INN (same ownership). SANDPIPER guests have the use of BOATSLIP, swimming pool deck, lounge, chairs. Free parking. Three short blocks away from PIED PIPER and other women's bars. Very very highly recommended.

title: Crown and Anchor Motor Inn
description: PO Box 111, 247 Commercial St 02657 Tel. 487 1430. Thirty hotel rooms, swimming pool (summer only), five bars, a restaurant, disco, entertainment center and a shopping arcade. Clientele: mostly gay men in summer season. Women are always most welcome, but 'post-season it was mixed straight and mostly gay men.'

title: Christopher Inn Guest House
description: 02657 Tel. 487 1920. Pool deck. Continental breakfast. Set ups. Open all year round. Center of town. Brochure and rates available on request.

title: Normandy house
description: 02657 Tel. 487 1197. 'Reasonably priced guest rooms, cottages and apartments.'

title: Carl's Guest House
description: 02657 Tel. 487 1650. 'Clean, comfortable, inexpensive. Convenient to all, friendly.' April through November.

title: Peasant Stock
description: Tel. 354 9528. International dishes from around the world. Beers and wines. Open for lunch, dinner, and Sunday brunch.

title: Women's Center
description: (above Laundromat) Tel. 628-6311 (Tuesday 7-9pm office hours). Women's coffeehouse every Mon eve at 7:30-10:30pm.

title: Di Rocco's Cabaret
description: (Rte 3A). Tel. 649-9186. Large disco- pulsating dance floor, pooltables, pinball, Live entertainment on Sunday evenings. Monthly buffet parties. Open Weds-Sun 8pm-1am. Fri Sat 8pm-2am. About 20% gay women. Recommended.

title: 59 Taylor
description: Tel. 736-5811. Disco and 'Duryee Room' -cocktail lounge. Open 7 days a week. 11am-2am. Disco from 9pm.

title: Wimmin's Music On WMHC
description: 91.5 FM Tel. 538-2044. Saturdays from 12 noon to 2pm. Cell in when they're on the air. 'Where wimmin are the sound of the world'.

title: Isaiah's Lounge
description: 01605 Tel. 798 8950/791 7195. A disco bar. Good place to talk and meet old and new friends. Monthly entertainment. Open: Sat- Sun from 4pm. Mon-Fri from 2pm. Closes 1 am Sun. The rest of the week it's 2am. Games and snacks and quite OK for gay men. Recommended.

title: The Uncommon Reader
description: Tel 791 5127. Open Monday to Saturday 10am-6pm. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: The Mailbox
description: 01068 Tel. 752-8993. There's a wide dance floor and the disco music is excellent. The DJ sits above in a room with glass window. Fantastic lights. Piano bar: gay singers- jazz and blues. Clientele: all gay. Closing time 2am.

title: The Gay Paper
description: 21203-0074. Gay newspaper, non-sexist, non porn. bar guide for women and men. One year's subscription donation of $15.00 or more. Includes current, correct information about local organizations including religious ones, political ones, black groups, alcoholics anonymous, teachers groups, handicapped groups, reading discussion groups, NOW and theater and made groups.

title: Open House
description: In Bowie, Columbia, Largo and New Carrolton there are regular 'open house' See BLADE OF DC for current details.

title: Gay Community Center
description: PO Box74 21203. Center Tel. 837 5445. Counseling Tel.5238592. Switchboard Tel.8378888. Clinic Tel.8372050. Clinic, counseling service, switchboard, gay paper, bookstore, library, game room, lounge, multi- purpose room. coffeehouse, gallery and meeting rooms.

title: Baltimore Black Lesbian and Gay Coalition
Women's Growth Center
description: Tel. 366-GROW. Referrals, therapy, lesbian rap groups and CR groups.

title: Gay AA
description: Tel. 243 4418 or 243 1783. They meet every Sat at 8:30pm- call for info.

title: Shot Tower Bar
description: Tel. 539-8942. Women. Live Entertainment. Open days. Food. Closed Mon.

title: Club Mitchell
description: Tel. 675 9701. Mostly women. Membership. Shows. Food. The most popular women's bar in Baltimore-knock for entrance. Open 8pm-2am 7 days a week.

title: The Butterfly
description: Tel. 276 9087. Mostly women. Neighborhood. Live entertainment. Open daytime.

title: Fran's
description: Tel. 7329815. Older crowd, unsophisticated atmosphere and very friendly.

title: The Masquerade
description: Tel. 327 9538 Youngish/mixed crowd. Open Mon-Sat. 8pm-2am. Sun 3pm-2am.

title: Julian's Lounge
description: Tel. 675 9637. Dance bar/young crowd. Clientele: 50% gay women. Open 9pm-2am. Closed Mondays. Men and women Dancing. Shows. Open 7 nights.

title: Lynn's of Baltimore
description: Tel. 685 9200. Men and women. Live entertainment. Dancing. Patio/sundeck. Closed Sunday

title: Port in a Storm
description: (FellsPoint)(1⁄2 block from S Broadway)T.el.2765336. 'Heavily into role playing' and' lots of hassle from straight guys and NOBODY SAYS A DAMN THING TO THEM',and the walls are decorated with oil paintings of menstruating women.. open 7.30pm-2am. (Oh yes, arcade games/good music/nice dance floor).

title: Alternative Press Center
description: Kirk and Gorsech Aves Tel. 243-2471. Largely lesbian bookstore/library/events center, info center.

title: O'Dells
description: Tel. 752 4449. Men and women (Monday Mostly Black), non-alcohol disco.

title: The 31st Street Bookstop
description: 21218 Tel. 243 3131. Books and records. Information center and a good place to go when new to Baltimore.

title: Sherman's Books
description: 21202. Tel. 837 3363. General bookstore-gay and feminist titles.

title: Montgomery Gay Rap Group
description: Montgomery County MD Tel. 963 0646. This is now an all-male group but contact the, for local referrals and check with BLADe of DC for information about the women's group.

title: Towson Books
description: (in the heart of Towson). Tel 321 6850. Gay titles and feminist titles. Hours: Mon-Sat 10am-9pm. Sunday 10am-5pm.

title: Community
description: Tel. 837 3363. General bookstore - gay and feminist titles.

title: Cogs
description: Tel. (Jan) 596 6070 (Kathy) 730 5838 (Amy) 997 0161. A strictly social group which meets every Weds in the HARRIET TUBMAN CENTER in Columbia.

title: Deer Park Lodge
description: Rte 40 up towards South Mountain Tel 790 2760. A good place to party on a Saturday night cos thats when the women show up!

title: Webwork
description: 04619. A correspondence contact club for Maine, new England and the Maritimes- to help lesbians and bi-sexual women to find each other now easily. Write for full details.

title: Bookland of Bath
description: 04530 Tel. 442-7447. They no longer have specific sections for women's titles because they're crowded but do carry quite a few anyway. Hours Mon-Sat 9:30-6pm.

title: Birds Nest Gallery
description: 04609 Tel. 288 4054. A great art gallery- the largest selection in Maine. Over 40 different artists-gay and straight.

title: The Susan B Anthony Club
description: c/o MLF PO Box 125 04915. 'A club for women identified women-created with the intention of getting social, cultural and educational events happening in Maine for women. 'Write for MLF for complete directions. (It's located in Downtown Belfast on Main St). Newsletter- Schedule of Happenings.

title: Maine Lesbian Feminists
description: 04915. Three divisions: North/Coast/South/Extremely active political and support group.

title: The Club
description: 03907 Tel. 646 9282. Featuring: happy hour and tee and dance, daily from 4 to 7. Only a one-minute stroll from town, with plenty of free parking. Southern Maine's newest and friendliest dance bar. Light Meals. Reasonable prices.

title: Dignity/Maine
description: 04240 Tel. 345 3195. For gay/lesbians/Catholics and their friends.

title: Valerie's
description: Tel. 646 2476. Full dinner menu and cozy piano bar.

title: The Inn At Two Village Square
description: 03907. Location 2 Main Street Tel. 646 5779. Perched on a hill overlooking the center of Ognuquit, the INN AT TWO VILLAGE SQUARE commands a sweeping view of the ocean. large, sunny common rooms, enclosed dining porch and a sundeck. Uniquely decorated guestrooms and continental breakfast. Gay owned and operated, they are a 'very welcome place for traveling women to stay'. Write for brochure and say hi from GAIA.

title: Capt Perkins Guest House
description: 'Full service bar and restaurant, good ample parking. Large comfortable rooms with antiques. Special off-season packages available.'

title: Yellow Monkey Guest House
description: Tel. 646 9056. Efficiencies, decks, ocean views available. Open thru Oct. 12. Run by Victor and Peter.

title: Seafair
description: Tel. 646-2181. Your hosts: David and Rod. Traditional accommodation and efficiencies. Complimentary continental breakfast.

title: Clipper Ship Guest House
description: (Rte 1) 03907 Tel. 646 9735. Located in two separate buildings, there are rooms, some with private baths and three apartments with kitchens. Everyone is welcome. Clientele: gay women, gay men and some straight people. 'We cater more for young people (mentally if not chronologically) an we have three miles of beautiful beach, discos, a playhouse, and lots of fun. 'Very, very highly recommended. Say that GAIA sent you.

title: The Collective
description: c/o Elve, 372 Preble St Sth Portland 04106. Portland Women's Community Newsletter published every month on various topics such as motherhood etc and every other month publishes a calender of events happening in the women's community, spirituals, dances etc.

title: New Leaf Books
description: Tel. 236-2030. Specializes in books by and about women. Publications from small presses etc. Non-sexist children's literature, women's music, and books that are simply fun. Hours 10:30am-5:30pm Monday thru Saturday.

title: Gay People's Alliance
description: 04103 tel. 780 4085. Your best contact if new to the scene in Maine.

title: Wilde Stein Club, Senior Skull Room
description: 04470 Tel. 581 1288. A non-profit group supporting the local gay community as well as the student community.

title: Sea Gnomes Home
description: 04681 Tel. 367 5076. A rooming house for womyn by the sea. Just rooms; no meals, projects, entertainment. It's a funky, partially restored victorian house offering semi-private rooms with double beds. two room suites are also available. The Rose Room, a parlour which looks out on the harbor and island is shared by all the guests. Peaceful and relaxing, SEA GNOMES HOME is very highly recommended by many GAIA readers. Say that GAIA sent you. Closed by the end of September.

title: Gay Switchboard
description: Tel. 577 3450. Mon-Thurs. 6pm-10pm and 6pm-11pm Fridays and Saturdays, 'volunteers needed'.

title: Lady's Love Disco
description: Tel. 892 6522. Extremely pleasant interior lots of plants and graphics. Small comfortable and highly recommended. Sunday brunch noon-3pm.

title: Amigas
description: Tel. 891 9795. Disco. Woman DJ on weekends. Open 7pm-2am (located three blocks North of 7 Mile Drive). 'Older crowd, role playing and the neighborhood is BAD.'

title: The Rubaiyat
description: (at Huron); 48106 Tel. 663 2401. Contradicting the description in GAIA'S GUIDE 1962, here is a description of the current scene at THE RUBAIAYAT: 'Disco and restaurant, lovely place. Clientele: ALL GAY- women and men mixing very well together. College crowd. your night is Wednesday and now highly recommended.'

title: Lesbian Advocate
description: 3116 Michigan Union 530 South State St 48104 Tel. 662 1977 (Hot Line 9am-5pm daily). 'We work closely with the lesbian and feminist communities as well as with students and gay men's Advocate office.' Peer counseling and referrals. Very handy NEWSLETTER/resource list. Social activities. Serving lesbians and working closely with bi-sexuals and straight women. 'All are welcome by appointment or by drop-in.'

title: Gigi's
description: Tel. 584 6525. 3 blocks east of Southfield and there is a disco. Upper deck for men, lower deck for women. Upper deck open from 2pm-2am. Bar for women opens at 8pm on Monday, Friday and Saturday. Friday night is the 'Gay Go-Go Gi~s·

title: Tiffany's
description: Mailing address PO Box 48303 17346 Woodward Ave (nr 6 Mile) Tel 956 8326. 2pm-2:30am.

title: The Deck
description: Pleasant, congenial neighborhood-type bar. Open 12 noon.

title: Menjo's
description: Popular disco with outdoor patio in the summer. Women mostly on Sunday.

title: The Underground
description: Tel. 341 4423. Find it at the corner of Greenfield. Gay women. Disco: dinner and breakfast. Open 8pm-2am. Until 4am weekends. Recommended. (Slightly older crowd'.)

title: Aruba
description: Tel. 893 8460. Large game room/Californian decor. Women always welcome.

title: Chosen Books
description: 48203. Alternative bookstore with gay and lesbian titles. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE.

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description: Meets every Sunday at 2pm in the Unitarian Church at the same address. Loosely affiliated with MOONRISE.

title: The Back Stage Deli
description: Tel. 892 9645. An Excellent and friendly restaurant near the bars.

title: Crew's Inn
description: Restaurant/bar combined. Dancing and good food 24 hours. Lots of women at weekends.

title: Papa Joe's
description: Tel. 458 2224. Mixed gay and some straights.

title: State Bar
description: Tel 767 7050. Open 7 days a week. Dance floor. Mixed. Owned by women.

title: NOW
description: c/o YWCA 25 Sheldon, SE. They meet the 1st Monday of every month at the YWCA. And are 'definitely OK'.

title: Ramblin's Inn
description: NE 49503 tel. 774 8663. 'This gay owned and operated restaurant features a wonderful yet inexpensive breakfast and lunch menu. Great even if you just go there for a cup of coffee. ' Its the place to find out what's going on in town. and should be your first stop in Grand Rapids. Hours: Tues-Fri 7am-33:30pm, Sat 8am-2:30om, Sun 9am-2pm. Get there early or you will have to stand in line.

title: Club 67
description: Tel. 454 8003. All gay bar with clientele of about 30% lesbians. Disco music after 9pm. It's a bar only- no restaurant and there is $1.00 cover charge. (better known as MARGARET'S0. Recommended.

title: Lady Moore's School of Self Defense
description: SE Tel. 459 9352. Classes for wimmin and classes for older folks, children, handicapped.

title: Joe Covello's
description: Tel. 482 4577 or 482 4557. All gay bar/mostly women on Thursday nights. College crowd, near Michigan State. No cover charge. A real old-timer. Say Hi from GAIA.

title: D's Lounge
description: Tel. 463 3079. Brought in 1961 by two women, its been expended and greatly improved. It's fun and it's friendly with food, games, raised dance floor and plenty of space. Clientele: gay men and women. Juke box music, tapes on weekends. Wednesday night the prices stay the same as the daytime prices. From 12 noon to 7pm it's 'double bottle' (two for the price of one). Highly recommended.

title: Pandora- A Womyn's Store
description: 49007 Tel. 388 5656. Feminist books records, cards, clothing, jewelry, ceramics, area womyn's newsletter and non-sexist children books and more. Open Tues-Sat 12 noon-7pm, Sun 1:00-5:00pm.

title: Douglas Dunes
description: Tel. 857 1401. Just a minute from beautiful Lake Michigan in Saugatuck/Douglas. This is an all gay resort with hotel accommodation, formal dining room, outdoor decked patio restaurant, two bars, game room and heated pool. There's bar service at the swimming pool and all the rooms are air conditioned. Color TV. Open all year. Ski-ing etc. It's highly recommended although it's now mostly gay men- 'Gay women are always welcome and well treated here.'

title: The Association of Suburban People (ASP)
description: Write ASP PO Box 568 48170 Tel. 349 4487. South Eastern Michigan based Gay Group. Contact them as well about the new Parents of Gay Group which is now forming.

title: The North End of Oval Beach
description: entrance fee on weekends only $5.00 '& watch out for Bookie the ageing, harmless voyeur who guards the dunes. 'All gay nude beach.

title: The Lesbian Survival Center
description: Tel 721 4666 The Circle of Ishtar, a group of lesbians of color meet in the Survival Center.

title: A Woman's Coffeehouse
description: Tel 871 1005 All women and their children welcome

title: The Blaisdell Place
description: Tel 872 2325 Private health and dining club

title: Christopher Street Inc
description: Tel 874 7877 Center for treatment of chemical dependency. Incest victim counseling

title: Gay Community Services Inc.
description: Tel 827 2821 Providing individual and group therapy.

title: Gay Nineties
description: Tel 333 7755 Scores high points for atmosphere and friendliness

title: Come Back Saloon
description: Tel 335 0835 Cowboy bar and good disco

title: Morning Star Women's Center
description: Tel 722 4448 Individual, group and family therapy

title: Duck Type
description: Tel 824 9990 Typesetting, layout, design for flyers, ads, books, magazines, posters, cards lesbian worker/owned

title: Book Rack
description: Tel 361 3420 General bookstore with gay/feminist section they sell Gaia's Guide

title: BJ's (Billie Jeens formally known as Monique's)
Actor's Sorority
description: Tel 483 5693 Local all women, feminist theater group

title: The Bowery
description: Mostly men and very few women

title: New Earth Bookstore
description: Tel 931 5794 A feminist bookstore committed to providing our community with alternative options with the largest selection of lesbian and gay books in the Kansas City area

title: Galaxie
description: Tel 862 8458 non-members can get in with a valid ID plus a copy of Gaia's guide

title: Trax
description: Tel 531 2210 Predominately a men's bar but women are welcome

title: Gay Talk
description: Tel 931 4470 Hot Line 24 hours 7 days a week

title: The Arabian Nights
description: No Phone Listed The oldest gay bar in Kansas City

title: UMC Women's Center
description: Tel 882 6621 Social Services, counseling, referrals and resources

title: Women's Eye Bookstore
description: Tel 721 1616 Feminist Bookstore Home of Tiamat Women's Press

title: Dover Fox
description: Tel 753 9777 Ok for women but 90% men

title: Mississippi Gay Alliance-Gulf Coast Chapter
description: Primarily concerned with the betterment of the Gay/Lesbian community

title: Le Bistro In Exil
description: Tel 388 9662 Pool table and video games

title: Mississippi Gay Alliance
description: Tel 355 7495 Their interests are civil rights and discrimination

title: Numbers Cruise Bar and Game Room
North Crow Vacation Ranch
description: Tel 676 5169 Owned and operated by gay women, they always schedule women only space

title: Women's Outreach Network
description: Tel 443 3379 Publish their own quarterly newsletter Tapestry

title: Out in Montana
description: Tel 728-6589 Extremely active group with six chapters throughout the state

title: The Resource Center
description: Tel 728 6948 Hosts coming out support and rap group for gay women and men

title: Women's Resource Center
description: Tel 243 4153 Primarily but not exclusively for students

title: Lambda Gay Alliance
description: Tel 587 1444 Social and political organization for lesbians and gay men

title: Montana Women's Lobbyist Fund
description: Tel 449 7917 Special Interest Group: a a coalition of women's organizations trying to represent a broad spectrum of women's issues in the Montana legislature

title: Northern Lights Cafe
description: Tel 443 9700 Operated by a collective of women

title: The Front Page/Bugle Publishing Inc Co
description:
Tel. 919 1829-01 Bl. Published twice monthly (except January and August). Lots of special features of
interest to gay women and free classified advertising for groups and individuals too. Subscription
rate $12.00 per year. Statewide community resource list, including women's resources, classified and women's personal column.

title: Feminary
description: No Phone Listing. A feminist journal for the South, emphasizing the lesbian vision. $2.50 per copy. $6.50 for 3 issues.

title: 42nd Street
description: Tel. 683-1151. Largest disco in the States. Mostly gay men but always about 30% gay women and recommended.

title: The Palms
description: Tel. 272-6307. Small place. Serves beer only. Juke box, DJ weekends. Pool table. Open 8.30pm-1.30am six days a week and closed on Sundays

title: The Front Page
description:
Tel. 829-0181. Subscription rates: $8.00 for one year (24 issues) gay newspaper. Community resource page for all groups: religious/AA/
outdoor/social/political/more.

title: Friends of Dorothy Bookshop
description:
Tel.
332-8893. This truly marvelous shop has got to be your first stop in Charlotte. Books, records,
greeting cards, arts and gifts. Lots of titles for women and for lesbians. Open 7pm-9pm
Wednesdays and Thursdays. 5pm-9pm Fridays. 1 pm-9pm Saturdays and 1 pm-5pm Sundays.
They sell GAIA'S GUIDE and have been extremely helpful to GAIA so please say 'Hi' when you
get there.

title: David's Lounge
description: Tel. 763-8068. Hot disco (enter through the back door at the rear of the building). Open daily 9pm-1.30am closed Tues.

title: Aware
description:
Tel. 723 8607. Just a group of people who meet in people's
homes the 3rd Sunday of each month for programs on topics such as gay literature and gay
health, followed by social activities.

title: Friends Lounge
description: Tel. 353-971 <1. Private Club. Disco. No food. Basically gay men but always about 30% gay women. Recommended.

title: Metropolitan Community Church Charlotte
description: Tel. 535-0541. Services Sundays at 7pm and Tuesday 7.30pm at Charlotte Unitarian Church. Referral service. Call Church for information.

title: O'Henrys
description:

GUIDE

description:
Tel. 321-8587. Women's
publication Includes comprehensive listing of services and agencies.

Tel. 781-3897. Disco on two floors-very popular and very nice.

RESOURCE CENTER - you can call for info about Dayton events. Arts and crafts gallery,

title: Calico's Coffeehouse
description: Tel 299 2878 Meetings/women-only events/Clientele: mostly women/feminist atmosphere.

title: Kismet Lounge

bar information.

Tel. 271-1765. A group of

description:
Tel. 461-0076. Dance bar with games. Clientele is

description: Tel. 226 9801. Dance floor/OJ/live music on weekends. Clientele: mostly gay women but a few gay men.

Tel. 244-9413 or 245-9413. 'The proprietors are super-nice

Although) It's a small place it's most definitely all gay (no straights allowed!) and the shows
that they offer once in a while are both entertaining and in good taste. Dancing also.

description:
Tel. 621-8414. Disco/bar open after 2.30am on weekends
although no liquor served after that time. A really nice all-gay bar, becoming more and more

disco and live music. Clientele: 50% gay women/50% gay men. Tuesdays mostly women.
Cocktail hour, 4pm-8pm. Open till 2.30am. Highly recommended

description:

buttons, pins, cards. Open 1 1 am-7pm during week, 12 noon-6pm weekends. They moved

Tel. 248-9204. Open 11am-12 midnight; Sundays

title: Tiger Lily Press
description: Tel. 241-4859. Collectively run women's printing press.

title: Caesar's
description:
Tel. 241-5140. More gay during the week, the weekend shows,

title: The Crazy Ladies Bookstore
description:
Tel. 541-4198. Open
Tue/Wed/Fri/Sat noon-6pm, Thurs, noon-8pm. The Crazy Ladies Bookstore keeps a large
stock of women's books, posters, cards, records, T-shirts and gilt items by local craftswomen. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE. Non-sexist kids books, etc. CRAZY LADIES is just a
great place to go to find friendly talkative helpful women. A stop there is recommended before a stop anywhere else in Cincinnati for the traveling lesbian since CRAZY LADIES
always know what's going on all over Cincinnati I say that GAIA sent you.

title: Scenic Bar
description:
Tel. 248-9717. New dance floor, juke box, pool tables. Clientele
varies. sometimes as much as 75% gay women, but sometimes less. Hours 1 pm-2.30am,

title: Coventry Books Inc
description:
Tel. 932-8111.
General bookstore with women's records/music, posters, buttons, used books, T-shirts.
Feminist small press titles. MAIL ORDER SERVICE. Referral service, meeting space, bulletin
board. We sell GAIA'S GUIDE and other lesbian and feminist periodicals'. lesbian owned.

title: Epic Book Shop
description:
Tel. 767-7997. New and used women's section. The
only source of feminist books in this area. Open 1 Oam-6pm Mon-Sat, 12 noon-6pm Sun.

title: Adam's Rib
description:
Tel. 281-9691. Sundays free brunch 4 till 8pm and
cocktail prices all night Sundays. Wednesdays live entertainment in the lounge (lounge opens

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description:
Tel. 836-3930
(Answering Service). Services Sundays at 330 Morewood Road. Counseling, rap groups, social activities, gay weddings, etc.

description:
Tel. 521-8352. They now have their own church
building and newsletter, DIFFERENT DRUMMER. The pastor is a lesbian and the
congregation is 60% lesbian. Social as well as religious and counselling activities. Be sure and

title: Zippers
description:
Tel. 749-9797 (taped message). Strictly private membership
club.

title: The Club
description:
Tel. 838-9283. Juke box and disco/dance bar.
Pool table/pin ball/private patio. Male and female impersonation shows plus open mike
nights. Open Tues-Thurs 7pm-2am; Fri/Sat 7pm-3am. Closed Sun and Mon. A private club

title: DJ's Club
description:
Tel. 942-9658. Dancing/pool tables/other games.
Sunday is brunch and games day. DJs is owned and operated by gay women. They-want ·a

club but you can get in with a copy of GAIA'S GUIDE and valid ID. They sell GAIA'S GUIDE and
are closed Mondays and Tuesdays. Open Weds/Sat 6pm-2am. Open Sundays: 3pmmidnight.
Very, very highly recommended. Be sure and say hi from GAIA.

title: King Arthur's
description:
Tel. 528 9671. Women's bar, restaurant too. Opens 12
noon.

title: Zoo Zoo's
description:
Tel. 344-4764. New location bigger and brighter now and still
the same great food. Natural foods restaurant. Thursday night is women's night. Open daily
Bam-1 0pm. Closed Tuesday. Wheelchair accessible. Table service.

title: Northwest Fountain
description:
Tel. 248-1990. Non-sexist
gay monthly newspaper. Includes lots of women's resources and bar-map guide to places in
Portland and Seattle. $10.00 per year (make checks payable to TAURUS PUBLICATIONS).

title: Mother Kali's Books
description:
Tel. 343 4864. A dyke hangout which sells GAIA'S
GUIDE. Has a list of places where traveling women can stay. Library and bulletin board.

title: Gayline
description:
Tel. 241-2251 24 hour recorded information on events and meetings in the gay
community.

title: Womansource
description:
No Phone Listing. Lesbian/feminist housing network for southern
Oregon. Contact them when new to the area and say hi from GAIA

title: Club 927
description:
Tel. 231-1606. Operated by gay woman. Game room, pool
tables. Basically disco music. DJ at weekends. Flo\\ restaurant. Live entertainment, video
games. Holds 150-175 people. Open 7 days a week 2pm-2,30am and till 4am Friday and Saturday (open for breakfast). Highly recommended.

title: Wilde Oscar
description:
Tel. 223-8620. An extremely unique bar and
restaurant with an outdoor patio and open-air theater - woman's groups, very special
happenings like weekend cabarets and art shows. Community minded and 'vary hospitable'.
A highly recommended old-timer open 11 am-1 am daily.

title: Home-Friend Truckshop
description:
Tel. 344-9988. Collectively run.
Burgers, chicken and vegetables. Open Bam-9pm. Closed Mondays. Extremely reasonable
prices. Bulletin board. Recommended.

title: Dahl & Penne's
description:
Tel. 228-7469. Basically a man's bar. Pool tabla,
dancing, show bar restaurant. Beer garden. During the week it's about 5% gay
women and weekends about 20% gay women. It's open from 7am-2.30am 7 days a weak.
The shows which are Friday and Saturday at 9pm and 11 .30pm are free.

title: Cook's Reception
description:
No Phone Listing. Not exclusively gay, but fun for all - and not uptight
about it

title: Darcelle XV Tavern
description:
Tel. 222-5338. Female impersonation shows.
Monday is burlesque night $5.00 cover. 'Incredibly delightful show bar but so popular that it's
not all gay now. Lots of people go but still recommended.'

title: Metropolitan Community Church
description:
Tel. 485-3665. Serving the Willamette Valley Area. The Gay and Lesbian community counseling services
have emerged through this MCC effort.

title: Jacqueline's See Vue Motel
description: Tel. 547-3227. On the beach. Private quiet rooms overlooking a remote stretch overlooking the beach.

description:
Tel. 236-3609. Books plus
periodicals, buttons, posters, records, community referral canter with a bulletin board and free
lending library. They publish an excellent newspaper which costs $0.25 and they sell GAIA'S
GUIDE. A good place to start out when you first hit Portland.

title: Riviera Room
description:
Tel. 344-4022/0434. Disco and snacks and the
restaurant SEYMOUR'S. Lounge happy hours and pinball, pool. Open 11am-2.30am. 75% gay
women

title: Goldstein & Drescher/Attorneys at Law
description:
Tel. 484-4435.
Serving the women's, alternative and political communities of Eugene.

title: Chuckles
description:
Tel. 223-2372. Juke box. Food is served. Pool
table. Clientele: all gay and 40% women. Open 7 days a week and recommended.

title: JOQ's Tavern
description:
Tel. 287-4210.
Neighborhood bar for gay men and women, inter racial. Video games, pool table, no dancing.
A real friendly place and recommended.

title: Fogelman's
description: No Phone Listing. After hours: for gay people only!

title: Hamburger Mary's
description: Tel. 223-0900 (Second location) 1441 NE Broadway Tel. 287-7715. Open 11am-12 midnight 7 days a weak. Bulletin board.

title: Wilde Oscar
description:
Tel. 223-8620. An unique bar and restaurant with an outdoor patio and open-air theater - women's groups, very special
happenings like weekend cabarets and art shows. Community minded and 'very hospitable'.
A highly recommended old-timer open 11 am-1 am daily.

title: Jonah's Galley & Pub
description:
Tel. 245-2188. Casual,
intimate, and relaxing. Steak and seafood. Brunch and dinner. Lunch 11-4.30 Dinner 4.30-11.
Sunday Champagne Brunch - recommended.

title: Goldenwimin
Hot Potata Cafe
description:
Tel. 223-7573. Gay run,
the food is _good and the waiters are very helpful, they even found us a place to stay.' Open
11am-10pm.

title: Women In Transition
description:
No Phone Listing. Southern Oregon State College; 97520. Information services and
newsletter.

title: The Iron Gate
description:
No Phone Listing. (Underneath a bar called Perry's downtown near the bus
station). Saturdays lots and lots of women. Thursday night is a good night tool Disco with a
good large dance floor. 2 pinball machines ad lots of video games. $1.50 cover charge on
Saturday and Friday nights but you get a coupon for a free well drink. Highly recommended
It's new, clean and nice. They serve beer, wine and cocktails.

title: The Experience Restuarant
description:
Tel. 563-4555. A unique, highly
recommended women-owned restaurant. Reservations only.

title: I Walama
description:
Tel. 342-6545. Does routine gynecological work and
invites women to take part in examinations. Referrals for gay women and other minorities.v

title: C C Slaughters
description:
Tel. 248-9135. Country and Western Bar and Restaurant. Pinball. Open 11am-2.30am daily. Clientale mostly gay and about 15%
gaywomen.

title: Mother Kali's Books
description:
Tel. 343-4864. Feminist and lesbian titles, they sell
GAIA'S GUIDE and is the focal point lesbian and feminist activities/happenings in
Eugene.

title: Old Wives' Tales
description:
Tat.
238-0470. Saturday and Sunday Brunch/Salad Bar. Fine desserts and expresso/beer and
wine. Children's playroom/Meeting and Banquet room. Featuring works of women musicians'.
artists and writers. Browsing library. Open every day; Mon-Thurs 11.30am-10pm, Friday
11.30am-11 pm. Sat 9am-11 pm, Sun. 9am-10pm. Be sure to say hi to Holly Hart from GAIA

title: Old Wives' Tales
description:
Tel. 238-0470. Saturday and Sunday Brunch/Salad Bar. Fina desserts and expresso/beer and
wine. Children's playroom/Meeting and Banquet room. Featuring works of women musicians,
artists and writers. Browsing library. Open every day; Mon-Thurs 1 l.30am-10pm, Fri
11.30am-11 pm. Sat 9am-11 pm, Sun. 9am-10pm. Be sure to say hi to Holly Hart from GAIA.

title: Older Women's Network (OWN)
description:
No Phone Listing. A support system in
the process of establishing a rural living community.

title: The Other Side of Midnight
description:
Tat. 233-0755. Three
pool tablas, and 3 pin-ball machines, wide screen TV. Featuring: hot and cold sandwiches,
cracker and cheese board, and home-made soups. Summer beer gardenI.t 's owneda nd
operated by women for woman. Hara are the directions: located under the eastbound
off-ramp of the Hawthome Bridge. Park your car beneath the bridge. Open: 6pm-1am Sunday
through Thursday and till 2.30am Fri & Sat. Vary highly recommended.

title: Star Flower
description:
Tel. 686-2151. Wholesale natural foods. Worker
owned and controlled. Feminist collective. Bulletin board.

title: Looking Glass Books
description:
Tel. 227-4760. Gay, lesbian and feminist titles.
Bulletin board. Children's section. Open Monday, Friday and Saturday 1 Oam-6.30pm. Tuesday
to Thursday 1 Oam-5.30pm. Closed on Sunday.

title: Women's Press
description:
Tel. 5B4-9329. Oregon's feminist newspaper and one
of my own favorites. News/announcements/classifieds. Only $5.00 per year. Bi-monthly.

title: Cassady's
description: Tel. 484-9983. Now it's a beer and wine bar especially for women on Friday and Saturday nights. The rest of the time the ratio is 10 men to 1 woman. Hours: 4pm-2.30am Monday to Thursday. 1 pm-2.30am Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

title: Keep Listening
description:
Tel. 239-6896. Ski
trips, biology and bicycling, rafting, backpacking and photography, outdoor leadership classes.
NO DOGS ARE ALLOWED ON KEEP LISTENING TRIPS.

title: Thyme
description: No Phone Listing. Oregon Women's Land.

title: Capitol Forum News
description:
Tel. 585-9295/232-0669. About to change title. Will have new
mailing address too.

title: Cabbage Lane
description: No Phone Listing. Women are welcome to build their own structures or just to drop by. Cabbage Lane has 60 acres.

title: Fly Away Home
description:
No Phone Listing. We are creating theater here in
these woods, and inventing ritual here in this silence. You are invited to join us for workshops
designed to share the fun, depth and power that we are discovering'.

title: Womensource
description:
No Phone Listing. 'We bring lesbian/feminist musicians and artists to
town. Hold annual fall and winter gatherings, maintain library and mailing list. Contact group
for lesbians in southern Oregon. There's more happening here than you think' Say hi from
GAIA.

title: Boxcar Flats
description:
Tel. 241-1368. Small cafe, seats 60. Woman owned. Serves
hamburgers and other sandwiches. Open 5.30pm-2am.· Extremely reasonable prices and
recommended.

title: Portland Town Council
description:
Tel. 227-2765. The emphasis is on the political: gay civil rights/military and veterans rights
included. Their publication is OREGON GAY RIGHTS REPORT. Membership Is $20.00 per
year or just $5.00 for the publication. The Lesbian Forum, sub-group, meets the third Monday
of each month for dinner and discussion programs. Also lesbian workshops.

title: Portland Feminist Women's Health Center
description:
Tel. 777-7044. Lesbian self-help group. Alternative fertilization program forthcoming. They
work in coalition with other lesbian groups and are open from 9am-5pm Monday through
Saturday.

title: Metropolitan Community Church of Portland
description:
Tel. 281-8868. The Christian Church with an outreach to the gay community. Social activities
as well as religious, counselling, referrals and job bank. Their publication is THE CHALICE and
they sell GA\A'S GUIDE

title: Metropolis
description:
Tel.. 223-3438. An excellent place for lesbian mothers to
come with their children.

title: Cassady's Tavern
description:
Tel. 581-2326. Owned by the same two men who
own CASSADY'S in Eugene. 'A great gay crowd - about 50-50 and all gay. The men seem to
occupy one side of the bar and the women the other- each have pool tables. The dance floor
is busy and they are expanding.'

title: Oregon Lesbian Political Caucus
description:
No Phone Listing. All women's
caucuses in Oregon can be contacted here. Both Statewide Caucus and Lesbian Caucus have wonderful retreats for workshops. They also have entertainment and exciting guests. The Workshops are to improve all political skills. Usually, they are held on women-owned land in
the mountains of Oregon. Also lesbian attorney referrals.

title: Gensis Juice Bar
description:
No Phone Listing. Juice Bar. Open Tues-Sat: Bam-6pm & Sundays:
11am-5pm. Closed Mondays.

title: Orpheus Club
description:
Tel. 921 8338. Opens 12 midnight 5/6pm. Fri and
Sat wild disco. Reportedly an after hours club and it's BYOB.

title: Sneakers
description: Tel. 922 9306. Women's bar, disco. Very highly recommended.

title: Natural Foods Eatery
description: Tel. KL-6-1360 Vegetarian cuisine. Eat in and take out.

title: 1 Metropolitan Community Church
description:
Tel. 546 5730. They hold their Sunday services at 6pm at the FIRST UNITARIAN
CHURCH, 2125 Chestnut St. Ring for other events, too.

title: DCA
description: Tel. 735 5772. After hours. Downstairs is open to women.

title: Gay News
description:
Tel. 625 8501. Statewide
gay newspaper - somewhat more for men than women in content, but its approach is
totally non-sexist. List of women's resources/bar guide and high standard book reviews.
$18.00. 26 issues $36.00.

title: Tel-A-Woman
description:
Tel. 103 8599. Monthly: free 'Information about
women's concems. We also publish a women's guide to Philadelphia and its vicinity. Taped
message for current local events.'

title: Shadows
description:
No Phone Listing. Downtown bar.
Quiet. Video Games. 70% gay men, 30% gay women.

title: The Eromin Center
description:
Tel. 732 3212 for information or appointment. Provides professional
counselling for individuals, couples, families and groups serving lesbians, gay men, bisexuals,
transsexuals and transvestites and local black gays chapter. Fees determined on a sliding
scale.

title: Rittenhouse Medical Associates
description:
Tel. 567 2031. 'Genera lmedicine
for the gay community.'

title: Shawn's
description:
Tel. 566 9194. A real old timer, but caution: this
bar Is located in the worst part of Pittsburgh.

title: The Inner Circle
description:
Tel. 3911593.
Very small but good food and a small bar. Clientele all gay women and men. Across the street
from BUYERS' MART. Highly recommended. Pittsburgh's No 1 gay restaurant.

title: The New Prelude
description:
Tel. 862 5171. 'Bar and disco that's still jumping.
Clientele: gay women and men. Atmosphere: lots of fun. $4.00 cover charge now but that

title: The Gold Standard
description: Tel. 729 6707. Seating for dinner: Tues-Sat 6-1Opm, Sunday 5-9pm. Please call ahead for menu and reservations.

title: Pegasus
description: No Phone Listing. Cocktail hour 4pm-8pm. Disco 9pm-2am. Mon-Sat 4pm-2am. Closed Sundays. Cover charge. Drag shows.

title: The Blue Bugle
description:
Tel. 4219370 Two bars/tables/juke box and dance floor.
Saturday nights you'll meet the women from Pacono mountains and Jersey who frequent thisbar on weekends. Recommended.

title: Stonewall
description:
Tel. 432 0706. 'Has two bars and a really great dance floor plus fantastic music. It's mostly gay men but on weekends there are a lot of gay
women.

title: Gay Switchboard
description: Tel. 234 0328 Volunteer staff badly needed infrequent service as a result of under staffing.

title: Wooden Shoe Books & Records
description:
Tel. 569 2477. An excellent
alternative bookstore featuring lots of women's titles, gay and lesbian titles. They sell records,

title: Psychological Alternatives
description:
Tel. 5461767. Hours by appointment.
Mon-Fri 8am-8pm. Sat9am to 5pm. Hours by appointment. Moderate fees. Professional

title: Woody's
description:
Tel. 5459188. Serving lunch Monday through Saturday 11am
to 3pm. Appetizers, salads,o omelets, strudel, chili, hot and cold sandwiches.Also take out

Tel. 255 9488. Disco bar 'very good' and lots of letters of
recommendation. Closed Mondays. Another report: spacious and charming - but difficult to

title: Gay Switchboard
description: Tel. 546 7100. Hours: Mon-Fri 6-11 pm plus Sat-Sun.

title: Venture Inn
description:
Tel. 545 8731. Bar, restaurant. Mostly men. Particularly
friendly for women.

title: RP Club
description:
Tel. 545 9181. Private Club, disco. 'A fabulous women's
bar, the music is great for dancing and it's open till 3am.' Gay women and men. Hours: Wed,

title: Land of Pizza
description:
Tel. 735 6650. The food is good and so is the
atmosphere. Very friendly to gay women and helpful with advice about local women's bars

description:

description:
Tel. 2952070.

title: Philadelphia Lesbian and Gay Task Force
description:
Tel. 386
1610/387 4626. We are a Civil rights organization and publish a quarterly bulletin.'

title: Giovanni's Room
description: Tel. 923 2960A gay bookstore with a huge variety of feminist and lesbian titles.

recommended

professional-type women.' Closed Mondays and Tuesdays and very highly recommended.

description:
Tel. 546 2093. Gay and concernedRoman Catholics. Mass is celebrated every Sunday night at 7pm at 2212 Spruce St. Also

description:
Tel. 352 9762. Private club/disco. Very much the same
clientele as C R CLUB.

title: Beth Ahavah
description:
Tel. 922 3872. Mail address: PO Box 756619101. Women's
night: First Friday of the month.

title: Oakland Women's Center
description:
Tel. 624 5956. political and
social activities plus counseling and referrals

title: The Baron

Tel. 862 9431.
Viscount Lounge overlooking the Garden, intimate living room atmosphere. The Fireside

title: Travelers
description: Tel. 361 9620. Clientele gay women and men, took over from the old TILDEN.

description: No Phone Listing.  Sleep away program for young women located on one entire side of a mountain. The average cost per young participant is $250.00 per two week session.

No Phone Listing. 'I stock turtlenecks, drawstring
pants, (for ritual, play, work), blue chambray shirts, the Jogbra, Womonsound tapes, classical music by women on records, signmaker cards, women-authored books, herbels for healing cooking, in soap and in toothpaste, the amazon tarot, dream pillows, canvas carryalls and more. My catalog is amazing. Send two stamps.

title: Rainbow Mountain Resort
description:
Tel. 223 8484. A great gay
resort. 50% gay women, 50% gay men.

title: La Pierre
description:
Tel. 943 9134. Good sized bar, a dance floor, a room in the back, and a pool table. $1.50 C0\18rc charge. Everyone is carded at the door. Phone GAYLINE8 63 0588

title: The Great Skate
description:
No Phone Listing. The Tuesday Night Club
every Tuesday evening from:, 9.30pm till 1 am plus the Sunday Night Club every Sunday

title: 14 Karat
description: No Phone Listing. Bar: mixed clientele.

title: Cafe Lafitte
description:
Tel. 985 1181. Cafe Lafitte Special. Sunday brunch from

description:
Tel. 4245367. Cross-country skiing.All women. For

title: Strawberry Inn

Tel. 234 4228. Sunday night is best. Downtown
type bar/ type people.
